terms-and-conditions.page-title: Terms and conditions of use and privacy notice statement
terms-and-conditions.page-heading: Terms and conditions of use and privacy notice statement
terms-and-conditions.intro-text: Thank you for using the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) online renewal application ("the renewal application"). We have developed important terms and conditions for using this service ("Terms"). Please read them carefully.

terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-legal-terms: PLEASE READ CAREFULLY. These Terms for the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) renewal application contain information about your legal rights and obligations and regulate your use of the renewal application. These Terms should be read in conjunction with the Canada.ca website Terms and Conditions. In case they are differing, the present Terms take precedence over Canada.ca Terms and Conditions.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-access-terms: Your access to and use of the renewal application including any and all content is subject to (1) your acceptance of, and (2) your compliance with these Terms.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-usage-terms: Every time you use the renewal application, these Terms will apply. By using the renewal application, you agree to abide by the following Terms. It is your responsibility to understand and retain these Terms.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-outage: There will be times when the system might be down for maintenance.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-timeout: If you are inactive for 15 minutes on the renewal application, your session will end and you will lose any information you entered.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.terms-rejection-policy: At any time you may decide not to accept the Terms, in which case you will not be permitted to access and use the renewal application.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.esdc-definition-clarification: In these Terms, "ESDC" refers to the Minister of Employment and Social Development, representing His Majesty the King in Right of Canada.

online-application.heading: Terms of Use for the Renewal Application:
online-application.self-agreement: Using the renewal application means that you have read and agree to these Terms and the Privacy Notice Statement. If, at any time, you withdraw your agreement to any of the Terms you must stop use of the renewal application.
online-application.on-behalf-of-someone-else: If you are using the Application on behalf of a child, by using the renewal application, you certify that you have all the necessary authority to agree to the Terms on behalf of that individual, and that you agree to the Terms on behalf of the individual you are representing.
online-application.at-your-own-risk: If you are using a shared computer or shared internet connection, you are using this service at your own risk, and you will need to keep any personal information safe. If you are using a public computer make sure to close the browser or log out when you are done.
online-application.msdc: ESDC uses services from Microsoft Corporation to run the renewal application. The Microsoft data centres used by ESDC are in Canada in accordance with <microsoftDataPrivacyPolicy>Microsoft Corporation's Terms of Service Agreement</microsoftDataPrivacyPolicy>.
online-application.antibot: ESDC uses hCaptcha anti-bot services for our online tools in accordance with hCaptcha's <hcaptchaTermsOfService>Terms of Service</hcaptchaTermsOfService>.

changes-to-these-terms-of-use.heading: Changes to these Terms of Use
changes-to-these-terms-of-use.esdc-terms-amendment-policy: ESDC may amend these Terms at any time and without notice. Such changes shall be effective immediately on the date they are published. By using the renewal application, you agree to abide by the amended Terms. You are responsible to ensure you understand and retain the amended Terms.

personal-information.heading: Personal Information
personal-information.service-canada-application-administratio: Service Canada, which is part of Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC), administers applications for the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) on behalf of Health Canada. The personal information collected in this renewal application is required for the purposes of renewing your coverage in the CDCP.
personal-information.share-information: ESDC may use or share the information you provide for policy analysis, research, monitoring and/or evaluation activities within ESDC, Health Canada and Statistics Canada. These uses or activities will not result in any administrative decisions made about you.
personal-information.collection-use: The collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information is authorized by, among other laws, the <cite>Department of Health Act</cite>, the <cite>Dental Care Measures Act</cite>, the <cite>Department of Employment and Social Development Act</cite>, and is protected by the provisions of the <cite>Privacy Act</cite>.
personal-information.microsoft-policy: ESDC carries out this application process using services from a third-party provider, Microsoft Corporation, which may be subject to foreign laws. For more information, see <microsoftDataPrivacyPolicy>Microsoft Data Privacy Policy & Privacy Principles</microsoftDataPrivacyPolicy>.

how-we-protect-your-privacy.heading: How we protect your privacy
how-we-protect-your-privacy.personal-information-rights-and-access: You have the right to the protection of, access to, and where applicable, the correction of your personal information. It is kept in the following personal information banks (PIBS):
how-we-protect-your-privacy.info-source-access: You can learn how to access this information in the government publication called <infosource>Info Source</infosource>. You can also access Info Source online at any Service Canada Centre.
how-we-protect-your-privacy.personal-information-handling-complaint-: If you do not agree with the way your personal information was handled by ESDC, you can contact the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada to <fileacomplaint>file a complaint</fileacomplaint>.
how-we-protect-your-privacy.application-participation: Participation in the CDCP is voluntary. However, refusal to provide information will result in ESDC being unable to process your renewal application.

government-of-canada-and-sun-life.heading: Government of Canada and Sun Life
government-of-canada-and-sun-life.share-info: Employment and Social Development Canada may share your personal information with Health Canada, the Canada Revenue Agency, and Sun Life to administer the plan, validate your eligibility, and register you for the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP).
government-of-canada-and-sun-life.disclose-info: Your information may also be disclosed to the CDCP benefits administrator (Sun Life), the benefits administrator's agents, and service providers for the purpose of underwriting, verification, administration, adjudication and investigation of claims under the CDCP.
government-of-canada-and-sun-life.sun-life-authorization: Sun Life is authorized to collect, use, and disclose information about you to any person or organization, including oral health providers, institutions, investigative services, and the CDCP, for the purposes of program administration, audit, claims and patient/client safety.

sharing-of-information-and-oral-health-p.heading: Sharing of information and Oral Health Providers
sharing-of-information-and-oral-health-p.enrol-consent: By renewing your CDCP coverage, you are also providing consent to your oral health providers to disclose all personal information, as authorized by the <cite>Department of Health Act</cite> and the <cite>Dental Care Measures Act</cite>, that may be considered useful by Sun Life in the context of program administration, conducting claims verifications, managing claims, and patient/client safety. This information may include, but is not limited to, details on the services provided, patient clinical data, payments, and X-rays.
sharing-of-information-and-oral-health-p.considered-minor: If you are considered a minor in your province or territory, your information can also be shared with your parents or legal guardians.

apply.application-consent: By continuing with this renewal application, you agree that you have read the above terms and conditions and privacy notice statement. In addition, you consent to the sharing of your personal information for the purposes listed above.

tax-filing.form-instructions: Have you, and if applicable, your spouse or common-law partner, filed your tax return for {{taxYear}} in Canada and received your Notice of Assessment?

error-message.tax-filing-required: Select whether or not you have filed your taxes

file-your-taxes.ineligible-to-renew: You are not eligible to renew your coverage for the Canadian Dental Care Plan at this time.
file-your-taxes.tax-not-filed: You, your spouse or common-law partner have not received your Notice of Assessment for {{taxYear}} from the Canada Revenue Agency.
file-your-taxes.unable-to-assess: We use the information from your tax file to verify that the income and residency eligibility requirements for the Canadian Dental Care Plan are met.
file-your-taxes.tax-info: For more information on how to file your taxes, visit <taxInfo>Get ready to do your taxes</taxInfo>.
file-your-taxes.renew-after: You can renew your coverage only after you or your spouse or common-law partner have filed your taxes and received your Notice of Assessment.

member-selection.page-title: Renew your Canadian Dental Care Plan benefits
member-selection.reviewed: The following member(s) have already renewed:
member-selection.form-instructions: Below is a list of members who can renew. Choose the member you want to renew for.
member-selection.continue-help: Once all the members you want to renew for are ready to submit, click 'Continue' to review and submit the application.

select-member.heading: Select a member
select-member.to-continue: You must select a member to continue.

dental-insurance.title: {{memberName}}: access to private dental insurance
dental-insurance.legend: Do you have access to private dental insurance or coverage?

list.employment: Through a parent or legal guardian's employment benefits including health and wellness accounts
list.pension: Through a parent or legal guardian's pension benefits
list.purchased: Purchased by a parent or legal guardian from an insurance or benefits company
list.professional: Through a professional or student organization

dental-insurance.option-yes: Yes, I have access to dental insurance or coverage
dental-insurance.option-no: No, I do not have access to dental insurance or coverage

additional-info.title: What does it mean to have access to private dental insurance or coverage?
additional-info.eligible: It means you do not have access to any type of dental insurance or coverage through:

eligible-list.employment-benefits: a parent or legal guardian's employment benefits, including health and wellness accounts

organization.note: Note: If the child is eligible for dental coverage through a parent or legal guardian's employment benefits, or through a professional or student organization, they're not eligible for the CDCP. This is true even if:
organization.not-take: you decide not to take it
organization.pay-premium: you have to pay a premium for it

pension.pension-benefits: a parent or legal guardian's pension benefits
pension.federal-provincial-territorial: this includes federal, provincial and territorial government employer pension plans

exceptions.eligible: Exception: The child may still be eligible if a parent or legal guardian is retired and:
exceptions.opted-out: opted out of pension benefits before December 11, 2023, and
exceptions.opt-back: can't opt back in under the pension rules

purchased-coverage.purchased-through: coverage bought by a parent or legal guardian through a group plan from an insurance or benefits company.
purchased-coverage.purchased-privately: if a parent or legal guardian purchased the child's current dental insurance policy privately (and not as part of any of the coverage described above), the child is not eligible for the CDCP while that coverage is in effect.

error-message.dental-insurance-required: Select whether you have access to dental insurance

demographic-survey.improve-cdcp: Answering these questions is optional. Your answers will help Health Canada improve the Canadian Dental Care Plan and make sure our services are accessible to everyone.
demographic-survey.confidential: The information collected will only be used for statistical purposes and will be kept confidential.
demographic-survey.impact-enrollment: Your completion of the demographic questions will not impact your enrolment in the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
demographic-survey.indigenous-status: Are you First Nations, Métis or Inuk (Inuit)?
demographic-survey.disability-status: Do you indentify as someone with a disability?
demographic-survey.disability-help-message: A person with a disability is a person who has a long-term difficulty or condition, such as vision, hearing, mobility, flexibility, dexterity, pain, learning, developmental, memory or mental health-related impairments, that limit their daily activities inside or outside the home such as at school, work, or in the community in general.
demographic-survey.ethnic-groups: In our society, people are often described by their race or racial background. These are not based in science, but our race may influence the way we are treated by individuals and institutions, and this may affect our health. Which category(ies) best describes you? Check all that apply:
demographic-survey.gender-help-message: Gender refers to current gender which may be different from sex assigned at birth and may be different from what is indicated on legal documents.

marital-status.marital-status: What is your current marital status?
marital-status.provide-sin: Provide the Social Insurance Number (SIN) of your current spouse or common-law partner. The information is required to calculate your adjusted family net income.
marital-status.required-information: Your spouse or common-law partner must submit their own application for the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
marital-status.confirm-checkbox: I confirm that my spouse or common-law partner is aware and has agreed to share their personal information.

error-message.confirm-required: Consent from spouse or common-law partner is required to proceed
error-message.date-of-birth-year-required: Enter year of birth, for example 1950
error-message.yob-is-past: Year of birth too far in the past
error-message.yob-is-future: Year of birth must be in the past

parent-or-guardian.form-instructions: Are you the parent or legal guardian of {{childName}}?

error-message.parent-or-guardian-required: Select whether you are the parent or legal guardian of this child

parent-or-guardian-required.page-title: You must be a parent or legal guardian
parent-or-guardian-required.must-be: You must be a parent or legal guardian.
parent-or-guardian-required.unable-to-apply: You are not able to apply for this child. You must be a parent or legal guardian to apply on behalf of a child.

dental-insurance.option-no: No, this child does not have access to dental insurance or coverage

additional-info.eligible: It means the child has access to any type of dental insurance or coverage through:

eligible-list.employment-benefits: a parent or legal guardian's employment benefits, including health and wellness accounts

organization.note: Note: If the child is eligible for dental coverage through a parent or legal guardian's employment benefits, or through a professional or student organization, they're not eligible for the CDCP. This is true even if:
organization.not-take: you decide not to take it
organization.pay-premium: you have to pay a premium for it

pension.pension-benefits: a parent or legal guardian's pension benefits
pension.federal-provincial-territorial: this includes federal, provincial and territorial government employer pension plans

exceptions.eligible: Exception: The child may still be eligible if a parent or legal guardian is retired and:
exceptions.opted-out: opted out of pension benefits before December 11, 2023, and
exceptions.opt-back: can't opt back in under the pension rules

purchased-coverage.purchased-through: coverage bought by a parent or legal guardian through a group plan from an insurance or benefits company.
purchased-coverage.purchased-privately: if a parent or legal guardian purchased the child's current dental insurance policy privately (and not as part of any of the coverage described above), the child is not eligible for the CDCP while that coverage is in effect.

error-message.dental-insurance-required: Select whether the child has access to dental insurance

update-dental-benefits.title: {{childName}}: access to other federal, provincial or territorial dental benefits
update-dental-benefits.access-to-dental: Access to dental coverage through a provincial, territorial or federal government social programs will not impact the child's eligibility for the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
update-dental-benefits.eligibility-criteria: If the child meets all the eligibility criteria, their coverage will be coordinated between the plans to ensure there are no gaps or duplication in coverage.

federal-benefits.title: Federal benefits
federal-benefits.legend: Does {{childName}} have other dental benefits through a federal social program aside from the Canadian Dental Care Plan?
federal-benefits.option-no: No, this child does not have federal benefits

social-programs.legend: Please select which social program this child is covered under. If this child has more than one, please select the one they use the most.

provincial-territorial-benefits.title: Provincial or territorial benefits
provincial-territorial-benefits.legend: Does {{childName}} have other dental benefits through a provincial or territorial social program aside from the Canadian Dental Care Plan?
provincial-territorial-benefits.option-yes: Yes, this child has provincial or territorial benefits
provincial-territorial-benefits.option-no: No, this child does not have provincial or territorial benefits

social-programs.radio-legend: Please select which social program this child is covered under. If this child has more than one, please select the one they use the most.

error-message.phone-number-alt-valid-international: Phone number does not exist. If it's an international phone number, add '+' in front

confirm-email.add-email: Email communication will help the Government of Canada and Sun Life contact you regarding your Canadian Dental Care Plan coverage. Otherwise, we'll contact you by mail.

add-or-update.legend: Would you like to receive email communication from Sun Life and the Government of Canada about your Canadian Dental Care Plan coverage?

error-message.add-or-update-required: Select whether you would like to update or add your email
error-message.ita-add-or-update-required: Select if you would like to receive email communication
error-message.email-match: The email addresses entered do not match

home-address.use-mailing-address: My mailing address is the same as my home address

address-field.address-note: Include apartment number (if applicable), street number, street name. For example: 123 Main Street Suite 4B

address-suggestion.address-selection-legend: Please select an address option below:
address-suggestion.description: There's a problem with the address you provided. Please select the address you want to use. If you live in an apartment or suite, make sure to include that information.

address-invalid.description: We could not verify your address. You can either update it or continue with the address you entered. If you live in an apartment or suite, make sure to include that information.

communication-preference.preferred-language: What is your preferred official language of communication?
communication-preference.preferred-method: How would you prefer to receive communication about your Canadian Dental Care Plan from Sun Life and the Government of Canada?

review-adult-information.read-carefully: Review this information carefully. The information provided will be used to update your Canadian Dental Care Plan member account.
review-adult-information.contact-service-canada: If you need to update your applicant information, contact Service Canada by calling <noWrap>1-833-537-4342</noWrap>.

spouse-consent.yes: My spouse or common-law partner is aware and has consented to sharing of their personal information.
spouse-consent.no: My spouse or common-law partner is aware and has not consented to sharing of their personal information.

review-adult-information.dental-insurance-title: Access to other dental insurance or coverage
review-adult-information.dental-benefit-change: Change answer to government dental benefits
review-adult-information.dental-benefit-has-access: Has access to the following benefits:

review-submit.form-instructions: You are submitting a renewal application for the following people:
review-submit.submit-p-proceed: By proceeding with this renewal application, you are agreeing to attest truthfully to the information provided.
review-submit.submit-p-false-info: If you provide false information on this application, you and others you applied for, may be removed from the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
review-submit.submit-p-repayment: If you or your family members were not eligible to renew, you or your family members may have to repay the full cost of care received through the Canadian Dental Care Plan.

review-child-information.read-carefully: Review this information carefully. The information provided will be used to update your Canadian Dental Care Plan member account.
review-child-information.contact-service-canada: If you need to update your child's information, contact Service Canada by calling <noWrap>1-833-537-4342</noWrap>.

review-child-information.dental-benefit-change: Change answer to government dental benefits

confirm.page-title: Your renewal for the Canadian Dental Care Plan is complete!
confirm.whats-next: You will receive a letter confirming eligibility
confirm.begin-process: We will begin processing your renewal application immediately. You can continue to use your Canadian Dental Care Plan benefits. You will receive a letter within 30 business days of submitting your renewal application to let you know if you're eligible for the upcoming coverage year.
confirm.cdcp-checker: You can use the <cdcpLink>Canadian Dental Care Plan Status Checker</cdcpLink> or call Service Canada at <noWrap>1-833-537-4342</noWrap> to track the progress of your renewal application or to receive more information.
confirm.dental-benefit-has-access: Has access to the following benefits:
confirm.dental-private: Access to dental insurance or coverage
confirm.is-parent: Parent or legal guardian of child

confirm-address.is-home-address-same-as-mailing-address: Is your home address the same as your mailing address?

error-message.is-home-address-same-as-mailing-address-: Select whether your home address is the same as your mailing address

verify-email.verification-code: An email with a verification code has been sent to {{email}}. Please enter the 5-digit verification code and select "Continue".
verify-email.request-new: It may take up to 60 seconds for the email to arrive. If you don't see it, check your junk or spam folder. If you still don't have the code, you can request a new one.
verify-email.unable-to-verify: If you are not able to verify your email, select “Back” to update the email address.

error-message.verification-code-max-attempts: You have entered an incorrect verification code more than 5 times. You must request a new code using the "Request new verification code" link below.

verification-code-alert.heading: The verification code entered does not match the code that was sent to the email address provided, or the code has expired.
verification-code-alert.detail: Please check the code and try again. If the issue continues, you can request a new code using the "Request new verification code" link below.

code-sent.heading: New verification code
code-sent.detail: A new verification code has been sent to {{email}}.
